one’s traditional, but two and three are for people to get their pants on.

So it’s okay for you to joke around?
Just as challenging?
As you?
Just as challenging as you?
Leonard breathes on me, too. It’s not a big deal.
Well, so does Leonard. It’s kind of annoying, but it’s not the end of the world.
You know, so does Leonard. Can’t I just get ready in the morning without him giving me his goofy thumbs-up? Hey-hey-hey.
Agreed. Thank you.
You know, one night, Leonard’s nose whistled so loud, I swear it was like sleeping on a train track.
Is it? Oh. It’s like his sinuses are right here in the car.
Yeah, I’ll take you for ice cream.
Oh, please, you’re barely interested in a physical relationship with one person. Why would you want to confuse and disappoint others?
You kiss your mother with that mouth? ‘Cause it’s fine.
Well, who you gonna hit on? The girl in front of us got strawberry. That’s your favourite.
What about the girl behind the counter?
Is it possible you might not actually want to meet someone?
Thank you.
All right. Come on. What is really going on with you?
All right.
Not relating. Go on.
Oh, now I’m with ya. Okay.
Oh, that’s awful.
Well, what happened with your dad?
You poor thing.
And you’re afraid you’re gonna do something like your dad did?
Down the road? Sheldon, she wanted to share a toothbrush holder with you, and now you’re at an ice cream parlour trying to pick up women.
Honey, instead of worrying about pain you might cause in the future, how about trying to fix the pain you’re causing her right now?
Okay.
Just finish your ice cream so I can get you home to bed.
We’re back.
We’re doing good. I think Sheldon has something he would like to say to Amy.
Do you want him back?
Call me crazy, but I found it moving.
Leonard: I’ll give you a hint. We’re watching Daredevil.
Won’t.
Don’t.
And I think the most helpful thing we can tell you is no backsies.
Hey, she didn’t compromise. She settled. There’s a difference.
When you live with someone, there’s gonna be conflict. You just have to keep communicating.
Hey, you can make jokes, but if this keeps up, he’s gonna move back in here.
Good. Then before we reintroduce them, we’ll give him one of her sweaters so he can get used to her scent again.
No, that’s actually what we did with him when Howard came back from space.
Look, here’s the thing you need to understand about Sheldon. He’s the worst.
I prefer to think of myself as five-ten, but I still need to get all my pants hemmed.
Don’t beat yourself up. You’ve never lived with anyone before.
And you’re starting out with Sheldon Cooper. That’s like getting your first pet and having it be, I don’t know, what’s a kind of pet that ruins your life?
Look, even when Penny and I started living together, there was a learning curve. But I promise you, it does get easier.
Yeah. My record was six.
No, don’t do that.
Oh, true, but think of how much you’ve accomplished. Who got him to stop Purelling his pocket change?
And who got him to put things other than gloves in the glove compartment?
And who got him to try a turkey dog?
How can you stop now? That’s like walking out of Pinocchio right before he becomes a real boy.
Of course you do.
Oh. He can try. He’d just need a good locksmith.
What do you think?
How you guys doing?
Why does she get that? We never got that.
I’m very happy for you.
Did we really need to be here for this?
Sheldon: Will you two please inform Amy how much you enjoy adhering to a strict bathroom schedule?
I can if you’d just roll over and accept your fate.
Oh, look who’s in favour of compromise, the woman who married Leonard Hofstadter.
Well I’m open to that.
I think we should see other people.
Well, as a male, I have an evolutionary drive to perpetuate my DNA. Restricting myself to a single partner is against my nature.
Don’t blame me. Blame your pal, biology. He’s the pervert pulling the strings here.
You know, people are quick to accuse me of being difficult to live with, but the truth is, Amy is just as challenging.
Yes.
Yes.
When we’re sleeping, she breathes on me. One night, it got so bad I almost grabbed Toto
She’s always complaining about people at work.
Do you know that when I get out of the shower, she eyes me up and down like I’m a piece of meat?
I know. Sometimes I would just like to be appreciated for my mind.
Have you noticed it’s always an A-flat?
If we’re just going to drive around aimlessly, the least you could do is take me for ice cream.
Well, see, why can’t Amy be that subservient? She has coitus one time, suddenly she’s Gloria Steinem. Anyway, I suppose an ice cream parlour will be a good place to meet other women.
Being with Amy has awoken the sexual creature within. When I see a pretty gal walking down the street, I think, hubba hubba, like any other guy.
No. No, if we both like it, I’ll spend the rest of my life opening the freezer and going, aw, no strawberry.
Hmm? Well, she spends her whole day scooping. One arm’s probably bigger than the other.
You are truly wise.
I’d say wise beyond your years, but you’re getting up there.
Penny, I am going to tell you a story that I’ve never told anyone.
I was 13 years old, and on spring break from college.
I came home early because they ran out of math to teach me.

My mother was at bible study. I walked in the house expecting to find it empty, and I heard a sound coming from my parents’ bedroom. When I opened the door, I saw my father having relations with another woman.
I know. It’s also why I never open a door without knocking three times. I mean, the first
We locked eyes, I ran to my room, and we never, ever spoke of it.
Since Amy and I have been living together, we’ve been bickering like my parents used to.
Yes. I need to prepare her now to save her from pain down the road.
Well, anything can sound silly when you put it in that tone.
I’m sure you’re right. I suppose I should apologize to you, as well.
That must have hurt watching me look for other women without ever even considering you. Please understand that I think of you as more of a nanny.
Hello.
I wanted to apologize for my behaviour today. It, it was unnecessary. This is warm. Oh, and also, I am willing to forego the bathroom schedule.
Amy, you should know I was never really interested in seeing other women. And to prove how serious I am about us, I’m willing to take our relationship to the next level.
Amy Farrah Fowler, will you share this toothbrush holder with me?
Amy: I told you, you can’t regulate every aspect of our lives.
I’m sorry for bringing this over here.
Sheldon, I understand that you like things a certain way and I’m willing to make some concessions, but you have to be open to compromise.
Okay. Well, for starters, there’s nothing wrong with keeping our toothbrushes in the same holder.
What?
We sleep together once a year. You want other partners?
You wanna see other people? Go see other people.
Why is nothing easy with him?
I prefer to think of it as high-maintenance.
I guess I should have known what I was getting myself into.
That’s true.
You’re not making me feel better.
He put a sign up in the bathroom that says, number of days without Amy’s hair on the soap.
Maybe I should just give in to his stupid bathroom schedule.
But you did.
It’s just so much easier to give him what he wants.
Me.
Me. It was mittens.
That was actually Koothrappali, but I did let him spit it out in my hand.
You know, you’re right. I’m in this relationship, too. I need to stand up for myself.
And if he doesn’t like it, he can move back here.
It’s a nice enough spot. You know, if I’m going to start standing up for myself, this is exactly the kind of thing…
Oh, hi. Hi.
Oh. Really?
I would love to.
Raj: What time do you and Bernadette head out?
I’ve never been to Palm Springs.
I don’t know. If I want to watch old people sweat, I can just FaceTime my family in India.
Hmm. They must have left the tub on. Good thing I stopped by. Ah. Aaaaah! What are you doing here?
Maybe Howard and Bernadette said I could be here.
Answer the question, what are you doing here?
Here you go.
Shall we toast?
So how’s your apartment?
So why don’t you get it fixed?
If you ever need somewhere to crash, there’s always my place.
Actually, I’m single now.
It’s okay. It’s by choice. Well, their choice, and it’s not okay.
Nobody does. I was embarrassed so I didn’t say anything.
Yeah, yeah, a little.
I’m in a hot tub with you, so pretty bad.
I wonder if this is what it feels like to be Bernadette’s baby.
Well, it’s getting late. Maybe we should head home.
You coming?
Why?
Yeah?
Howard: As soon as I get home. We’re hoping to make it before dark.
Well, she wants us to spend more time together before the baby comes.
Well, he wants us to spend more time together before the baby comes.
Honey, how ya feeling? (Sound of Bernadette vomiting violently) The book says at this stage of the pregnancy morning sickness should be going away. (More vomiting) So that’s good news, right?
There she is. Who’s ready for a hot, three-hour car ride to the desert?
I’m sorry. We don’t have to go.
How ’bout we stay here? We don’t even have to tell anyone. It’ll be like a secret vacation at home.
Does it sound sexy?
You bet I did.
You know what’s weird? How turned on you are right now.
Well, pulling a quarter out of your ear isn’t the only magic these hands can do. In fact, what’s this between your toes?
It sounded like it. Oh, my God. Someone’s in the house.
We should call the police.
Damn, so did I.
What are we gonna do, e-mail 911?
You know I rely on humour in times of stress.
Is that the hot tub?
Well, the answer is both more and less disturbing than you think.
Stuart. He heard me talking about us going away. I guess he decided to invite himself over?
Maybe. How ’bout, hey, you look like a boiled chicken breast?
Nah, that’s not gonna hurt his feelings.
Maybe this is why people get fish tanks. Who just turned the porch lights on?
Well, clearly, I lied.
He’s in our hot tub drinking our wine.
Those jets are for my secret spot, not his.
It’s called relaxing, and that’s all you need to know.
You jackasses just bought yourselves a hot tub!
Stuart: Oh, you should go. It’s terrific. I really thrive anywhere the women and the temperature are over 90.
It’s nice you and Bernadette are getting away.
So then what are you doing here buying comic books?
What are you doing here?
Did they?
I had nothing else to do tonight. The last couple of months, I come here when I know they’re not home.
They heard me in the bushes once, but they thought I was a raccoon.
Thank you.
To Howard and Bernadette, and the house key they never asked me to return.
Not great. The electricity’s out.
I called, and they’re like, pay your bill.
Oh, no. I don’t want to be an inconvenience. You’ve got all your lady friends, and…
What? When did that happen?
Oh. Sorry. I didn’t know.
So you’re back out on the dating scene now?
Oh, that must be fun. How’s that going?
I don’t know. Bernadette’s baby doesn’t have a Jacuzzi jet hitting just the right spot.
Yeah, you’re probably right.
Yeah, just give me a minute.
Well, you know how you’re wearing a bathing suit?
I kind of went the other way.
Bernadette (pff): The only thing I hate more than you right now is that book.
Bernadette: Next vomit is gonna be in your lap.

Keeping secrets from our friends, it does sound kinda fun.
You just heard me throwing up.
You’re so weird.
That feels great.

Uh, I left my phone downstairs.
Wait, I have my iPad.

You said you got it back.

Yeah, he deserves to be alone.
What do you do in there?
